record.title: ORDERS FOR TUESDAY, MARCH 11, 2008
record.narrative:
ORDERS FOR TUESDAY, MARCH 11, 2008 -- (Senate - March 10, 2008)

[Page: S1823]

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that when the Senate completes its business today, it stand adjourned until tomorrow, March 11, at 10 a.m.; that following the prayer and pledge, the Journal of proceedings be approved to date, the morning hour be deemed expired, the time for the two leaders be reserved for their use later in the day, the Senate proceed to a period of morning business for up to 1 hour, with Senators permitted to speak therein for up to 10 minutes each and the time equally divided and controlled between the two leaders or their designees, with the Republicans controlling the first half and the majority controlling the final half; that following morning business, the Senate resume consideration of S. Con. Res. 70, the concurrent resolution on the budget. But the time, as we have already entered in

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
